allData.occupation: Head of Unit, International Value Chains - DG GROW at European Commission

positions.title: Head of Unit, International Value Chains
Deputy and Head of Unit ad interim, Standards Policy - DG GROW
positions.description:
Acting and Deputy Head of Unit of the Standards Policy Unit: defining the unit’s overall objectives and work program and allocating resources to achieve those objectives; ensuring effective People Management; establishing and managing the annual budgetary resources allocated to the Unit; representing the European Commission on standards-related matters within and vis-à-vis inter-institutional and other stakeholders.

- Managing European standards regulation
- Managing relations with European standardisation bodies
- Development of policy priorities through standards with a view to the green and digital transition and resilience objectives
- Management and mining of HASS data base
- Management of inter-institutional relations
- Relations with international standardisation bodies
- Stakeholder engagement, in particular with SMEs, consumers, trade unions and NGOs

positions.title: Assistant to the Director General and Deputy Director Generals, DG GROW
positions.description:
November 2014 - July 2016 assistant to the DDG, since July 2016 assistant to the DG and DDG.

- Assist the Director General and Deputy Director General in the overall management of her/his tasks in particular with regard to the Directorates she is responsible for.
- Ensure the follow-up of the DG/DDG's decisions.
- APrepare meetings and ensure follow up on issues relevant to the work of the DG/DDG.
- Handle correspondence and ensure appropriate follow-up, including : oversee attribution, screen responses, draft replies. 
- Read, prioritise and comment on files submitted to the DG/DDG.
- Co-ordinate the preparation of briefing material, speeches etc. 
- Provide advice and assistance as appropriate to the Directorates under the responsibility of the DG/DDG and liaise with other relevant Directorate-Generals.
- Provide advice and input on specific files, policy development, and the definition of strategic objectives.
- Participate to the drafting of the work programme of the Directorate general (setting priorities)
- Follow the relations of the DG/DDG with the various stakeholders.
- Co-ordinate the input of Directorates under her responsibility to the Directorate General work programme
- Liaise with the Cabinet of the responsible Commissioner
- Ensure the follow-up of the Directorate General's work programme.
 - Ensure the co-ordination of tasks relating to issues involving several services within the Directorate General
- Assist in the supervision of data protection issues.
- Contribute to the preparation of meetings of the relevant Councils and committees of the European Parliament including briefings.
- Ensure the follow-up of relations with the other institutions on matters covered by her Directorates

positions.title: Policy Officer for Corporate Social Responsibility in DG Enterprise & Industry

educations.fieldOfStudy: Political Sciences, General Economics, International Law
